description: Ms. codex. Title from title page (fol. 1a). 11 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red for headings, overlining of keywords and re-inking. Red teardrop textstops. Light cream paper, glossy, with laid and chain lines visible. Marginal annotations. Several inscriptions, including short excerpts, on fol. 1a. Ijāzah dated Rabīʻ II 9-3 on fol. 58a-b. Ijāzah signed Muḥammad ibn Ramaḍān al-Ḥanafī, dated Madrasah al-... (in Damascus added by another hand on the margin), Dhū al-Qaʻdah 879 on fol. 59a. Copy completed on 13 Rajab 872 [Feb. 7, 1468] by Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Zuhayrī al-Ḥanafī (colophon, fol. 57b). Incipit: قال الشيخ العلامة حافظ الدين ابو البركات عبد الله بن احمد بن محمود النسفى رحمه الله الحمد لله الذي هدانا الى الصراط المستقيم والصلوة على من اختصّ بالخلق العظيم وعلى اله الذين قاموا بنصرة الدين القويم اعلم انّ اصول الشرع ثلاثة الكتاب والسنّة واجماع الامة والاصل الرابع القياس Explicit: وحرمة تحتمل السقوط لكنها لم تسقط بعدد الكرة واحتملت الرخصة ايضا ... ولهذا اذا اصبر في هذين القسمين حتى قتل صار شهيدًا
author: Nasafī, ʻAbd Allāh ibn Aḥmad, -1310
extent: 59 leaves: paper ; 175 x 130 (85 x 75) mm. bound to 175 x 135 mm.
title: Kitāb al-Manār fī uṣūl al-fiqh al-Ḥanafīyah
provenance: Several ownership statements on fol. 1a, in the name of Aḥmad Wahabī, etc., one dated 1168 H. [1754 or 55]. Erased impression of a square seal on fol. 2a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
creator: نسفي، عبد الله بن احمد
subject: Islamic law—Interpretation and construction—13th century
binding note: Paper with gold arabesques on a red(?) ground pasted on paper pasteboards for upper and lower cover and envelope flap. Red leather spine and fore-edge flap. Yellow paper pastedown. Leather doublure visible on the edges and on the fore-edge flap. Spine damaged. Disbound.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
